intro: Acisanthera beccabunga, commonly known as the water buttercup, is a herbaceous aquatic plant native to wetlands and marshy areas. It features small, yellow flowers with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Ranunculaceae family. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are floating or submerged, depending on the water depth. Its roots help stabilize soil and improve water quality by filtering nutrients. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
